content:
Posted: February 21, 2016
 "LINE UP! I'm offering free tickets to HELL"	 Quick Summary	SS3 is a frantic fps game, with a few bugs and some bad level design. It also has some balancing problems, mainly concerning hitscan enemies. Despite these issues, the game is still very fun and I highly recommend picking it up, especially if you enjoy first person shooters. Overview	Serious Sam 3: BFE is a fast-paced first person shooter where you play as Sam "Serious" Stone, a badass one-liner spewing hero,  who must fight against legions of aliens in order to save Earth. SS3 is very old-school, meaning that regenerating health is non-existant, levels are huge, wide open areas, and you have a wide variety of huge guns. Story	The story takes place before Serious Sam: The First Encounter (hence the subtitle BFE), earth discovers ancient artifacts in ancient Egypt which make space and time-travel possible. In the future, earth is attacked by aliens, led by an overlord named Mental. The aliens then manage to kill of most of the human race. As a last resort, Sam is chosen to find the Time-lock, an artifact which will allow a single person to travel to a different period of time in history. Gameplay	Sam moves fast, and most of the weapons fire fast too. You get a hold of around 11 weapons, and 2 secret ones. SS3 probably has the most satisfying gameplay of the Serious Sam games, each weapon has a kick to it and feels very powerful. Enemies explode in a shower of blood when killed, gibs flying everywhere. A new feature SS3 has is a melee ability, when pressing E when close to an enemy, you will brutally kill or kick them, depending on what it is you are meleeing. Most of the gameplay consists of you strafing out of the way of projectiles fired by aliens while firing at them. What really sets SS apart from other games is the amount of enemies you go up against. You will find yourself fighting hundreds of enemies per level, in huge arenas. What I don't like	The game has a few glitches, like if you are reloading and you melee an enemy your arm and gun will go into a strange position. While this can be ignored, The awful level design cannot. By far the worst levels in this game are the ones where you are underground in dark caverns with a flashlight. These areas have few enemies other than the annoying space monkeys and you spend most of your time wondering when you would get back to the surface. The first few levels of the game are also pretty bad, to the point where I don't this that this was originally going to be a Serious Sam game, The Cairo levels in particular were really linear and boring. Another issue I have with this game are the hitscan enemies. I can live with the arachnoids, but the technopolips and cloned shotgunners and riflemen were really bad, especially when in large arenas. Overall	Overall, Serious Sam 3 is a really fun game that is so close to being an amazing game. The game is worth it, even at full price. If you have a few friends around and some extra cash to spend, I can't think of a better game to buy and enjoy with them. Verdict: 8/10

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 30, 2013
												A relatively dated game-play style, shot through with enough testosterone to kill an adult elephant, Serious Sam BFE is what Duke Nukem Forever should have been. It’s all about grabbing a gun, gritting your teeth and blasting a path of destruction through invading alien hordes. The levels feel nice and open, and the number of enemies this game seems to be able to manage is simply staggering! At one point in the game, we spent two and a half HOURS with Miniguns shooting the hundreds and hundreds and hundreds that poured towards us. They were falling like flies but  we were constantly driven backwards by the enourmous tide of monsters. The game is superbly balanced and constantly represents a challenge. It’s absolute non-stop chaos from start to finish. If like time to pause in your games to take in the scenery, then this is not the game for you. It’s hilarious, fast paced, and above all else masses and masses of fun. If old style shooters like Doom and Duke Nukem are your thing, then you are going to love this. Recommended? Oh yes! Seriously!

												Do you enjoy egyptian ruins and desert? Do you enjoy massive hordes of annoyingly hard-to-kill enemies? Do you enjoy some of the cheesiest voice acting, complete with one of the dumbest stories ever?Oh boy, have I got the game for YOU!Serious Sam 3 is a very, very, very, very, very stupid shooter. It has large open arenas, lots of enemies to shoot and guns. You can also RIP AND TEAR your enemies with your bare hands, which is ofter far more effective than shooting them, so go figure.I can't even imagine playing this solo, but with a friend to share the misery, the game became mostly bearable. Still, I wouldn't play it again, nor do I plan on wasting money on the DLC.Playtime: 13+ hours (single playthrough)Ratings (1-10)Visual: 7Audio: 7Story: 2Gameplay: 4Overall: 4

content:
Posted: September 15, 2015
												To quote Sam himself: "WOOOHOO!"I have four accounts on Steam and I got them all for the Christmas bonus DLC a couple of years ago, but also to be able to do the achievements over again. Wrestling Kleers, breaking soldier necks, the Old School achievement, etc, etc. Needless to say I've truly enjoyed this game, despite of quite a few bugs, like switching to last used weapon, which only works in like three out of five times and causes a great amount of unneeded stress in all the mayhem and chaos. I don't know what causes this. This is basically my biggest and probably only gripe about the game, because at times it's a game breaker. Your plans get screwed up and you'll have to try to improvise in a millisecond.Combined, I have played this game almost 450 hours since it was released. That says something, other than the fact I have no life. ._.I started out like a total n00b on Tourist and stayed there embarrassingly long. I mean, it's almost impossible to die, unless you let yourself get totally surrounded by strong monsters, like Kleers, Kamikazes, Khnums or Major Biomechs, and go AFK for a drink or something...I feel like I missed out a lot to not having raised the bar quicker.At the moment, however, I'm enjoying the game on Serious (x56) and I couldn't imagine ever going back to anything easier (except for a few achievements that virtually require a lower difficulty), even if I think I'd never attempt a x84 run. That's just too much and takes more skill than I could dream of.Anyway, I'm rambling I guess. But this game is massively, insanely fun. Some have complained about the lack of story. But it's Serious Sam for crying out loud. Not an epic drama. Sheesh. There are however some moments where the "momentum" is killed by having to e.g. deactivate turrets which (at least for me) disorients and disrupts. Not so much fun looking for switches. And there are  hidden doors you need to open with switches as well. Most of them are underground. The parts of such levels are definitely my least favorites, plus they are combined with IMO the most annoying enemies in the game - the cave demons which just hop around erratically as you try to kill them and just move on. Sometimes they even jump to some unreachable area or get stuck. However non-moving enemies are quite common or enemies that gets trapped in the environment so you'll have to waste a lot of time trying to find them and kill them.There's some learning curve to the game, naturally. For me it was learning how to effectively use the most popular weapon in the game, the mutilator, It can also be used for more than just killing enemies and destroying stuff. It's a fact that the mutilator can kill enemies a lot faster than for example the minigun and the XL2 laser gun, if you play on normal and above (enemies have the same HP on normal as on e.g. serious).Another big challenge with the game is learning which enemies spawn at what point and where, and in what order. I haven't felt I have the capacity to learn this for the bigger levels and grand fights, but it's possible and makes your life so much easier. Still, I guess my favorite parts of the game is when you're about to deal with a "war ship" that can basically spawn enemies endlessly unless you deal with the ship itself and get out of the mess it can create. You can control the chaos. If you want to, that is. :)So yeah this is a great game which you should add to your libr-- AHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHH!

content:
Posted: December 29, 2011
												Absolutely amazing. I can't ask much more from a Serious Sam revival. The engine and interface are beautifully crafted and the enemies and details ooze realism. Usually game revivals fall flat but Serious Sam 3 BFE goes above and beyond! The next gen shooter mechanics such as sprint and true ADS, are integrated very well into the old school gameplay that the serious sam series is known for. I knew it was going to be good, I didn't realise just how good until I started playing.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 28, 2012
												For anyone looking for a good classic FPS experience, this is it. No cover or regenerating health, just you, hordes of aliens, and a ton of health packs and huge satisfying weapons along the way. Anybody who grew up with or prefer more traditional FPS games is going to enjoy this a lot. It looks great, it feels and plays great, and running n' gunning through the strewn entrails of your extra-terrestrial adversaries has never felt better.Needless to say, this is the kind of shooter many of us have been waiting for, it's the kind of revival Duke Nukem Forever wished it was, it's the gore and explosion filled kind of shooter we all loved as children, and it's a kind of game we can only hope for more of. Developers take note: less cowering behind cover. More sledgehammers.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 8, 2014
												I haven't really played for a long time, but from what I've played so far, it's incredibly fun. There's a cartoony, bloody, arcade machine style humor and sense of awareness that other games strive for, but end up creating a cheesy shadow of. It invokes the coin eaters of days gone by, with the easy logic employed in its difficulty level, and the scale of difficulty in levels. It's a video game lovers video game. This is no pseudo intellectual "Gone Home" level crap, this is a video game that wants to be fun, first and foremost; in short, it wants to be a video game worth playing. It's polished, and the shooting and gameplay mechanics are so well done, that it's impossible to get mad at it, even if you find yourself stuck on a part. I'd recommend this at any price for people who love to play games, and enjoy them as games.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 8, 2014
												I haven't really played for a long time, but from what I've played so far, it's incredibly fun. There's a cartoony, bloody, arcade machine style humor and sense of awareness that other games strive for, but end up creating a cheesy shadow of. It invokes the coin eaters of days gone by, with the easy logic employed in its difficulty level, and the scale of difficulty in levels. It's a video game lovers video game. This is no pseudo intellectual "Gone Home" level crap, this is a video game that wants to be fun, first and foremost; in short, it wants to be a video game worth playing. It's polished, and the shooting and gameplay mechanics are so well done, that it's impossible to get mad at it, even if you find yourself stuck on a part. I'd recommend this at any price for people who love to play games, and enjoy them as games.

content:
Posted: May 28, 2015
Atomic Penguin's Tasty Recipe for Amazing Local Co-op Fun!!Ingredients:Pick almost any Serious Sam game (SS3:BFE recommended, but any version works equally well)RL friends, preferably all in the same roomCopious amounts of your group's favorite beverages & snacks (caffeine optional)Directions:Start gameAdd in Friends in local co-opSettle dispute over who gets to be Groovy GregoryStirLet sit 2-4 hoursMix in beverages and Snacks as neededThis recipe has been in my family for years. We use this regularly because we all enjoy it so much. I suggest at least once per month, though you can enjoy it more often if your group chooses to.This is so easy and has so much flavor! Yummy Rocket Launching Goodness!! Honestly, there's nothing else like it. Bon Appétit.*Seriously, this game has no flaws. It's non-stop action at it's mindless best. Get it for everyone in your family, even if they don't usually play games. Fire it up, make the server private, get everyone in the game, and let the good times roll.

content:

												Lets be straight, im doing this for the holliday gift item.. But while im doing it i may as well give a brief review: Its ♥♥♥♥ing amazing.Serious sam is what doom3 should have been, and wants to be. Heres the gameplay - You have a gun, you have a hoard of♥♥♥♥♥♥running towards you, you need to kill everything. Simple. This game doesn't need to ♥♥♥♥ around with perks, sweeping naratives,  cover based shooting, hell even cover itself. This is straight up old school FPS at its absoulete best. Be prepared to bust out circle strafes and rocket spam to the max as♥♥♥♥♥♥will literally be hitting fans... and walls, floors, faces, etc.It turns out i cant write as much as i would actually like to due to a character limit, so let me just say this. If you like old school FPS. If you like the feeling of being up♥♥♥♥♥♥creek with only a rocket launcher as a paddle, you'll love Serious Sam 3
